tn.text: lived for many years
This is a short name for the Jordan River.
This indicates the direction of the setting sun.

tn.ref: turning aside from it neither to the right hand nor to the left
tn.text: Disobeying the commands of the law of Moses is spoken of as turning to the right or to the left away from a path. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
Possible meanings are 1) having close friendship with them or 2) intermarrying with them.
to speak of
This refers to the gods of the remaining nations.
"hold tightly to Yahweh." Believing in Yahweh is spoken of as if they were holding tightly onto him. AT: "continue to believe in Yahweh" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
"until the present time"
Here "stand" represents holding ground in a battle. The word "you" refers to the entire nation of Israel. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_youdual]])
"one" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])
"1,000" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])

tn.ref: cling to the survivors of these nations
tn.text: Accepting the beliefs of these nations is spoken of as holding tightly to them. AT: "accept the beliefs of the survivors of these nations" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

The words "snare" and "trap" mean basically the same thing. Together they speak of the other nations as if they were a deadly trap that will cause trouble for Israel. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: whips on your backs and thorns in your eyes
tn.text: These phrases speak of the troubles these nations will cause Israel as if they were as painful as whips and thorns. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: I am going the way of all the earth
tn.text: Joshua uses a polite term to refer to his death. AT: "I am going to die" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_euphemism]])

tn.ref: know with all your hearts and souls
tn.text: Here the words "hearts" and "souls" have similar meanings. Together they emphasize deep personal knowledge. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])

tn.ref: not one word has failed to come true
tn.text: These words emphasize that Yahweh's promises have all occurred. This can be stated in positive form. AT: "every word has come true" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublenegatives]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])
This refers to the punishment threatened in the previous verse.

tn.ref: worship other gods and bow down to them
tn.text: These two phrases mean basically the same thing. The second describes how the people "worship other gods." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])

tn.ref: the anger of Yahweh will be kindled against you
tn.text: "Kindled" is a metaphor for the beginning of Yahweh's anger, like a fire is "kindled" or started with "kindling" or very easy to start burning like dried grass or small twigs. AT: "Yahweh will begin to be angry with you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
